images.caption:
Granular aggregate of silver 4 mm in galena with pyrite (yellow), Horní Město deposit
Photo by J. Sejkora

Argentite – black granular clusters up to 7 mm, there is granular silver in the centre of a number of clusters, quartz-carbonate vein, Horní Město deposit
Photo by P. Rozsíval

Proustite – red granular cluster 5 mm with galena (grey) in quartz, Horní Město deposit
Photo by J. Sejkora

Chalcocite – grey grains of metallic lustre up to 2 mm in quartz, malachite, Skály deposit
Photo by J. Král

Malachite – green needles up to 2.5 mm in quartz, Skály deposit
Photo by J. Král

Blue beryl (11 mm) in quartz, quartz is bordered by the position of hematite (extracted iron ore), Skály deposit
Photo by J. Král

Granulose cluster of blue beryl (13 mm) in quartz-carbonate vein, Skály deposit
Photo by J. Král
